name: Malibu
description: Famous surf destination in Southern California, known for its long right-hand point breaks and surf culture.

name: Huntington Beach
description: Surf City USA, featuring consistent beach breaks and a vibrant surf community.

name: San Diego
description: Diverse surf spots from point breaks to beach breaks, with year-round surfable conditions.

name: Santa Cruz
description: Northern California surf mecca with powerful waves and cold water conditions.

name: Half Moon Bay
description: Home to Mavericks, one of the world's most challenging big wave spots.

name: Oahu North Shore
description: World-famous surf destination with legendary breaks like Pipeline, Sunset Beach, and Waimea Bay.

name: Oahu South Shore
description: Gentler waves perfect for beginners, with spots like Waikiki and Ala Moana.

name: Gold Coast
description: Queensland's premier surf destination with world-class point breaks like Snapper Rocks and Kirra.

name: Sunshine Coast
description: Less crowded alternative to the Gold Coast with quality waves and beautiful beaches.

name: Sydney Northern Beaches
description: Iconic surf spots like Manly, Freshwater, and Narrabeen with consistent waves.

name: Sydney Eastern Suburbs
description: Bondi Beach and surrounding areas, popular with locals and tourists alike.

name: Cronulla
description: Southern Sydney surf destination with quality beach breaks and point breaks.
